1.title: Book of Love

episode of.title: The Akua Benjamin Legacy Project: celebrating 50 years of black activism (TV Series 2016)

1.plot: Honours the legacy of Gwen and Lenny Johnson, owners of the Third World Bookstore in Toronto. The store was located originally at Gerrard Street and Bay Street and then Bathurst Street and Bloor Street West aka Blackhurst.

2.title: Where Is Marlene Green

episode of.title: The Akua Benjamin Legacy Project: celebrating 50 years of black activism (TV Series 2016)

2.plot: Marlene Green's legacy has been literally written out of the history of black activism in Toronto and we uncover the clues that reveal her very significant contribution.

3.title: Rosie, the Fearless Rebel

episode of.title: The Akua Benjamin Legacy Project: celebrating 50 years of black activism (TV Series 2016)

3.plot: Roosevelt Bernard Douglas was a rebel with a cause.

4.title: Charley

episode of.title: The Akua Benjamin Legacy Project: celebrating 50 years of black activism (TV Series 2016)

4.plot: Charles Roach fighting for the immigration of Caribbean men and women was not just a civil rights lawyer but a renaissance man.

5.title: Dudley Speaks for Me

episode of.title: The Akua Benjamin Legacy Project: celebrating 50 years of black activism (TV Series 2016)

5.plot: Follows the legacy of activist Dudley Laws (May 7,1934 - March 24, 2011) and why he was such a force to be reckoned with in the fight of injustice.

imdb.title: The Akua Benjamin Legacy Project: celebrating 50 years of black activism
akas: The Akua Benjamin Legacy Project: celebrating 50 years of black activism (Canada)
plot: This ground breaking documentary series celebrates the contributions of black activists in Toronto, Canada through the lives of the late Gwen and Lenny Johnson, Marleen Green, Rosie Douglas, Charles Roach and Dudley Laws.::Fenton
